meanings.definition: To surpass in quoting or citing.
meanings.sent1: She always outquotes her classmates in history discussions.
meanings.sent2: He outquotes his friends when it comes to movie trivia.
meanings.sent3: During the debate, she managed to outquotes her opponent with ease.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outquotes others makes him a valuable resource in the team.
meanings.sent5: The professor's knowledge outquotes anyone else in the department.

meanings.definition: To quote or cite more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The student tends to outquotes the teacher in research papers.
meanings.sent2: She outquotes her colleagues in academic articles.
meanings.sent3: In the library, he always manages to outquotes the other patrons.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to outquotes others in the field is truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The author's work consistently outquotes that of his peers.
